H0.text: Exocytosis is the process of vesicles fusing with the plasma membrane and releasing their contents to the outside of the cell.

H1.text: Biosynthesis is the process of vesicles fusing with the plasma membrane and releasing their contents to the outside of the cell.

H2.text: Plasmosis is the term that describes the process of vesicles fusing with the plasma membrane and releasing their contents to the outside of the cell.

H3.text: Endocytosis is the term that describes the process of vesicles fusing with the plasma membrane and releasing their contents to the outside of the cell.

A4.text: Vesicles containing these membrane components fully fuse with and become part of the outer cell membrane.

A5.text: The substances within the vesicle are released into the exterior.
